title: Bug 21706 - BidiUtil in win32 has Class.forName() usage
description: Bug 21706 - BidiUtil in win32 has Class.forName() usage
OB: The issue is with the usage of `Class.forName()` in the `BidiUtil` class on win32 platform. Specifically, there is a line in the `BidiUtil` class: `static Callback callback = new Callback (BidiUtil.class, "windowProc", 4);` The `BidiUtil.class` is used as syntactic sugar for `Class.forName("org...BidiUtil")`.
EB: The expected behavior is to remove the usage of `Class.forName()` and instead add a private constructor. Since there are no non-static methods in this class, it would be appropriate to have a private constructor. This change will prevent unnecessary instantiation of the class and will not add any additional size.
SR:
To reproduce the issue and verify the change, follow these steps:
1. Open the source code for the `BidiUtil` class on win32 platform.
2. Locate the line: `static Callback callback = new Callback (BidiUtil.class, "windowProc", 4);`
3. Replace the line with a private constructor: `private BidiUtil() {}`.
4. Recompile the code and ensure that there are no compiler errors.
5. Verify that the issue with `NoClassDefFoundError` is no longer present when using the CLDC version of SWT.
